final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from the juxtaposition between intention and action. On one side, there's a silhouette of a person exercising on a fitness machine, signifying a commitment to physical activity and fitness, captioned with "YES." This represents the idea of being active and working out.

On the other side, a woman, dressed casually, is seen waiting for an elevator to go to the gym, despite the stairs being right next to the elevator. The stairs, representing a basic form of exercise, are unutilized. This scenario is captioned with "BUT," highlighting the irony and laziness of taking an elevator to exercise instead of simply using the stairs. The satire pokes fun at people who seek convenience even when engaged in fitness activities.
ground_truth: The image is ironic, because in the left image a woman is seen using the stair climber machine at the gym but the same woman is not ready to climb up some stairs for going to the gym and is calling for the lift
